Gardens at Belmont Mansion, Nashville, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Garden Study Club of Nashville, Parthenon Press
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This garden plan, showing curved paths surrounding statuary and fountains in a formal garden with a house and other structures surrounded by a perimeter of trees was drawn as if from above.

The formal gardens of Belmont Mansion, an Italian villa-style home, were located on a large piece of acreage on the outskirts of Nashville. The mansion's furnishings and garden would have reflected the latest taste for Adelicia Hayes Acklen was one of the wealthiest women in Nashville. She traveled to Europe after the Civil War and returned with the type of statuary and furnishings commonly associated with the "grand tour."
